Reason: The 'batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly affects the rate at which failed batches are replayed, which can have a significant impact on system performance. The code snippet shows that the configuration is used to set the throttle limit for replaying batches, and this operation can be time-expensive depending on the throttle limit set. If the throttle limit is too low, it can cause delays in processing failed batches, while setting a higher throttle limit may increase the system load. Therefore, any changes to this configuration can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
